Title: Most Chicks Won't Eat Veal: Original Pilot
Description: After his wife kicks him out of the house, Alan has to move in with his brother Charlie.

Title: Pilot
Description: After 12 years of marriage, Alan's wife, Judith, kicks him out. He turns to his older brother, Charlie, for help. Charlie has trouble adjusting his carefree lifestyle with the presence of his ten-year old nephew.

Title: Big Flappy Bastards
Description: Alan punishes Jake for an incident at Judith's house. Charlie is lax in enforcing Alan's restrictions, then some seagulls invade Charlie's house as a result of Jake's actions, Charlie has to learn how to discipline his nephew.

Title: Go East on Sunset Until You Reach the Gates of Hell
Description: Charlie and Alan go out drinking. Alan tries to reconcile with his wife. After that fails, they decide to confront the root of their issues, their mother.

Title: If I Can't Write My Chocolate Song, I'm Going to Take a Nap
Description: As Charlie tries to write a new jingle, Berta quits. Alan tries to convince her to come back. Leaving Charlie to get Jake ready for a dinner. And Rose tries to get Charlie's help to prepare for a date.

Title: The Last Thing You Want Is to Wind Up with a Hump
Description: Jake's soccer games lead to Alan and Charlie having encounters with teammates' sexy mothers.

Title: Did You Check with the Captain of the Flying Monkeys?
Description: Charlie and Evelyn date members of the same family.

Title: If They Do Go Either Way, They're Usually Fake
Description: Jake sees a butterfly tattoo on the firm bottom of a surfer-chick friend of Charlie's and draws a picture of it for school. Of course, this enrages Judith until she becomes very good friends with the woman herself.

Title: Twenty-five Little Pre-pubers Without a Snoot-ful
Description: After being tricked into helping Alan and Judith produce Jake's classroom musical, Charlie is flattered to find out that the kids know all the words to his jingles. Alan is blind-sided with divorce papers from Judith, causing strife which results in Charlie, who refuses to deal with the pre-pubers without a snootful, having to produce the play on his own. Jake is crushed when he realizes that a reconciliation between his parents may never happen.

Title: Phase One, Complete
Description: Charlie wants to dump a female friend to whom Jake has grown attached. Alan and Rose bond over a game of Scrabble.

Title: Merry Thanksgiving
Description: Thanksgiving winds up being the least thankful day of the year for Charlie, who has to bribe various members of his household to even come to a traditional turkey dinner. Not only are the usual feuds in evidence (leading to a turkey-carving right out of "Psycho") but Judith's parents are actually sympathetic to Alan and hostile to their own daughter for her "fling" with lesbianism.

Title: Alan Harper, Frontier Chiropractor
Description: Seeing Judith's new look and boyfriend prompts Alan to realize that if he wants to get back into the dating scene, he will need to change his look also.

Title: Camel Filters and Pheromones
Description: Berta brings her 16 year old granddaughter to work. She poses issues for the men.

Title: Sarah Like Puny Alan
Description: Charlie tries to nurse Alan back from the flu because he needs him for a double date with sisters.

Title: I Can't Afford Hyenas
Description: Charlie's accountant Stan tries to make Charlie understand his desperate financial situation.

Title: Round One to the Hot Crazy Chick
Description: Charlie falls for a seemingly crazy woman named Frankie--against Alan's advice.

Title: That Was Saliva, Alan
Description: Now that Frankie has tricked the Harpers into taking her and her daughter Joanie in, she explains that Bob's parents want her declared mentally incompetent in order to get custody. Charlie wants to dump her, but Alan insists on taking them both in. Jake doesn't enjoy the 8 year old's 'romantic' attention. Charlie hates the consolation kisses and compliments, and is stunned when Frankie prefers intimacy with Alan. Charlie rightly warns him he's just falling for his 'damsel in distress', but warns her not to hurt his kid brother.

Title: Ate the Hamburgers, Wearing the Hats
Description: Charlie is offended when Alan chooses his married, responsible cousins as Jake's guardians.

Title: An Old Flame with a New Wick
Description: Charlie's old flame, Jill, comes for a visit, she had an operation and is now called "Bill". Then Evelyn starts dating Bill.

Title: I Remember the Coatroom, I Just Don't Remember You
Description: Judith's sister Liz comes for a visit.

Title: Hey, I Can Pee Outside in the Dark
Description: Jake plays electric guitar all day long and doesn't want to do anything else. Alan and Charlie can't figure out why. Jake refuses to discuss anything with anyone, including his grandmother and even a psychologist.

Title: No Sniffing, No Wowing
Description: Charlie tries to seduce Alan's divorce lawyer, Laura, and her assistant. He sleeps with Laura and they decide not to tell Alan anything since it's unethical, considering that Charlie is a participant in the case.

Title: My Doctor Has a Cow Puppet
Description: Charlie notices that Alan sleepwalks and tries to find out what's causing it and how to deal with it. He asks for help from their mother, Evelyn, and Jake's psychologist, Dr. Linda Freeman.

Title: Just Like Buffalo
Description: Jake repeats something Charlie says to Judith. Then Judith refuses to let Alan take Jake for the weekend. Alan tries to talk to Judith, but encounters resistance from Judith and her friends. It's up to Charlie to set things right.

Title: Can You Feel My Finger
Description: Charlie is sure he isn't ready for fatherhood after a year of trying to raise Jake, so he opts to have a vasectomy. But when the doctor performing the procedure keeps getting calls from his wife -- who's about to give birth -- Charlie starts to think about what fatherhood might entail and likes the idea, provided he still has his vital organs intact (in more ways than one).

Title: Back Off Mary Poppins
Description: Charlie is having some friends coming over to his house to have a gathering but Alan is not invited. Things got worse when Alan is also not invited to Judith's party even though her guests are Alan's friends.

Title: Enjoy Those Garlic Balls
Description: Alan is hurt after finding out Judith is seeing Jake's pediatrician. Meanwhile, Evelyn tries to find out why Charlie hates her.

Title: A Bag Full of Jawea
Description: After Jake flips off his teacher, Alan and Judith move to punish him. Charlie, meanwhile, has other plans for Jake's teacher. Chaos ensues when Jake discovers the relationship and the increasingly overbearing Miss Pasternak tells Charlie she believes God brought them together.

Title: Go Get Mommy's Bra
Description: After Charlie reluctantly lends Evelyn his new car, he later discovers her bra in the back seat. Meanwhile, Alan is forced to compensate after Jake gets attached to Judith's rich and talented boyfriend.

Title: Bad News from the Clinic
Description: Charlie is dating a self-assured woman who plays hard to get, easily dismisses him, and he finds it disarming. Rose gets Charlie to see that his new lady-friend, Sherry, is in his head because she is just like him; a self-centered, manipulative, narcissist. Charlie debates breaking it off. Alan and Jake fiercely battle wills over Jake doing his homework.

Title: The Price of Healthy Gums Is Eternal Vigilance
Description: After confessing responsibility for a childhood shoplifting incident blamed on Alan, Charlie seeks the forgiveness of his now infuriated brother.

Title: A Kosher Slaughterhouse Out in Fontana
Description: Evelyn announces she is receiving an honor from the real estate industry and that Charlie and Alan will host a party in her honor. Mayhem ensues when Berta and her sister agree to cater the event, but sibling rivalry takes center stage.

Title: Frankenstein and the Horny Villagers
Description: Alan gets carried away with a woman he met at the supermarket, and it's up to Charlie to talk some sense into him while shielding Jake and Judith from what's going on.

Title: Yes, Monsignor
Description: Charlie runs into a newly-divorced ex, now single mom, who's willing to give him another shot. Back home, Jake tries to diagnose his learning problems.

Title: The Salmon Under My Sweater
Description: Charlie struggles to write a jingle for a new cartoon. Meanwhile, Alan spends time with Rose, and Jake procrastinates doing a book report.

Title: Last Chance to See Those Tattoos
Description: Charlie sets out to find who started a derogatory web site about him. Meanwhile, Alan overhears something he shouldn't on Jake's webcam.

Title: A Lung Full of Alan
Description: An old classmate is in town while Charlie and Alan spar over whom she likes more.

Title: Zejdz z Zmoich Wlosów
Description: Tensions rise after an earthquake displaces Judith to Charlie's house.

Title: Those Big Pink Things with Coconut
Description: Evelyn's condescending attitude towards Jake's good grades sets Charlie and Alan out for revenge.

Title: Smell the Umbrella Stand
Description: Charlie and Alan's weekend trip to Las Vegas has a little trouble getting off the ground.

Title: Can You Eat Human Flesh with Wooden Teeth?
Description: It's the week of hell as Judith's out of town, Alan's got Jake, and nothing seems to be going right.

Title: Woo-Hoo, a Hernia-Exam!
Description: Berta teaches Jake something about cleanliness while Charlie's in pain after a sexual encounter went horribly wrong.

Title: It Was Mame, Mom
Description: Charlie cons Alan into being his date at his gay friend's dinner party. But how long can they keep up the act?

Title: A Low, Guttural Tongue-Flapping Noise
Description: A freak food-flinging accident leaves Alan with impaired vision, which doesn't bode well especially when he draws a liking to one of Charlie's exes.

Title: I Always Wanted a Shaved Monkey
Description: Rose intervenes after Alan and Charlie come to blows over some of their unresolved issues.

Title: A Sympathetic Crotch to Cry On
Description: After one of her ex-husbands dies, Evelyn summons Alan, Charlie, and Jake to the funeral, where Charlie takes a keen interest in the widow.

Title: That Old Hose Bag Is My Mother
Description: Alan borrows money from Evelyn to buy a Porsche. However, life doesn't become as glamorous as he expects.

Title: Squab, Squab, Squab, Squab, Squab
Description: After finding out that Jake has spent the night at his other grandparents' house, Evelyn insists that Jake spend a night at her place. After convincing Jake to stay at her place, Alan and Charlie worry about how Jake will be affected by his overnight visit.

Title: Does This Smell Funny to You
Description: Jake recounts his weekend in which Charlie's latest fling is with a woman who turns out to be married to a now very angry old man.

Title: Weekend in Bangkok with Two Olympic Gymnasts
Description: After Alan falls off the roof, Charlie has to look after the adolescent and increasingly obnoxious Jake for the weekend.

Title: Principal Gallagher's Lesbian Lover
Description: Alan has to lobby the principal to keep Jake from getting expelled, while Charlie is left to manage the chiropractic office for the day.

Title: Carpet Burns and a Bite Mark
Description: After it's revealed Alan and Judith have been trying to reconcile, Charlie, Evelyn, and Rose vie for the role of spoiler.

Title: Your Dismissive Attitude Toward Boobs
Description: Alan looks for a new place after he invites Berta to stay at Charlie's house, bringing the brothers to blows.

Title: We Called It Mr. Pinky
Description: Charlie's inability to reciprocate his girlfriend's love forces him to examine his relationships with women.

Title: Hi, Mr. Horned One
Description: Charlie's Satan-worshiping girlfriend has a knack for the supernatural, and seems to be the cause of some strange happenings around the Harper house.

Title: Sleep Tight, Puddin' Pop
Description: Charlie gets drunk and sleeps with Rose on her birthday. Rose says she knows it's no big deal. But her father quickly shows up at Charlie's house, under the impression that they've been dating for two years.

Title: That Voodoo That I Do Do
Description: Charlie bribes Jake into taking ballet lessons so he can vie for the affections of the teacher. Things go awry, however, when Charlie and Jake find themselves competing for those affections.

Title: Madame and Her Special Friend
Description: Charlie's elderly neighbor has an uncomfortable business proposition for Alan.

Title: Something Salted and Twisted
Description: After Alan goes on a dinner with Jake, Charlie and Evelyn, he becomes fed up with seeking approval from women and decides to quit doing so with a little help from Charlie.

Title: Santa's Village of the Damned
Description: Alan's girlfriend Sandy is Malibu's answer to Martha Stewart, causing Alan and Charlie to pack on the pounds. Their desire for her fabulous culinary output is ultimately overwhelmed by her craziness.

Title: That Special Tug
Description: After a disastrous evening out with his brother, Charlie decides it is time to see a shrink.

Title: Humiliation Is a Visual Medium
Description: Charlie has to decide whether he can really commit to a serious relationship with Mia, especially when sex is currently off the agenda. Unsurprisingly, his suggestion that he sleep with other women in the meantime falls on somewhat stony ground.

Title: Love Isn't Blind, It's Retarded
Description: As Charlie tries to receive his version of benefits from the relationship he has with Mia, Alan starts dating Charlie's most recent ex-girlfriend.

Title: My Tongue Is Meat
Description: Forced to hide in his garage to enjoy a brace of beers and half a Cuban cigar, Charlie's attempts to keep his unhealthy lifestyle habits secret from Mia fall apart when she smells bacon on his breath, resulting in their first major argument since taking their relationship to a physical plane.

Title: Ergo, the Booty Call
Description: Jake's twelfth birthday approaches. Alan is busy with young, hot Kandi.

Title: The Unfortunate Little Schnauzer
Description: Charlie is nominated for an award, but he knows his rival Archie will win, as usual, so he doesn't want to attend it. Rose asks Charlie to help her with her boyfriend Gordon.

Title: The Spit-Covered Cobbler
Description: Alan is having financial problems: Kandi is too "expensive" for him.

Title: Golly Moses, She's a Muffin
Description: Charlie learns that Kandi has been living with them for three weeks. It turns out he hasn't even noticed some furniture changes. Alan wants to try her as secretary, but Charlie doesn't think she's smart enough for that.

Title: Always a Bridesmaid, Never a Burro
Description: Alan is made to admit to Charlie, who keeps hitting it in, he has hit rock-bottom now that his brainless girlfriend Kandi has moved in with his ex. It's all so confusing that Jake would prefer dad's ladies to be lesbians, then tells him Kandi's mom Mandi has joined Charlie's endless list of sexual conquests. Alan can't talk to Kandi, she just repeats Judith's phrases, clearly without understanding the words, but he sees her dad, Mandi's ex Andy, arrive on blind date with his own ex Judith. Frolicking finale at Judith's, in rooms, bed and hot-tub.

Title: And the Plot Moistens
Description: Alan turns to Jake's teacher for stimulating conversation, since Kandi obviously can't provide any. But the teacher starts to get the wrong idea about Alan's intentions.

Title: Just Once with Aunt Sophie
Description: Jake has his first boys-girls party, dating a smart girl, Wendy Cho. Alan was looking forward to coaching his son, but even Jake, who spends his schooldays watching the clock tick, isn't dumb enough to consider dating advice from the worst womanizer in L.A., while Charlie proves he can coach a virtually hopeless case -Alan and Judith's genes without the IQ- trough appearance, dance and anything else. In fact Alan envies Jake so much, he still hopes for ...

Title: Arguments for the Quickie
Description: Mia comes back and asks Charlie to donate his sperm. He agrees to, but for some unknown reason he can't deliver.

Title: That Pistol-Packin' Hermaphrodite
Description: Charlie and Mia discover that setting up a wedding with their two crazy families is a disaster, so they decide to get married in Las Vegas.

Title: Working for Caligula
Description: Kandi dumps Alan, which forces him and Jake to move back in with Charlie, who was just getting used to getting his bachelor pad back.

Title: Who's Vod Kanockers
Description: Charlie starts to lose control now that Mia's gone and Alan and Jake are back, and his frustration culminates in a violent confrontation with his new neighbor, Steven Tyler.

Title: The Sea Is a Harsh Mistress
Description: In the middle of a near-death experience, Charlie thinks he hears his father's voice tell him to take care of his mother, who is just about to have a "minor procedure" performed on her.

Title: A Pot Smoking Monkey
Description: Alan wants custody of the dog Chester he shared in his late marriage with Kandi. Meanwhile, Charlie helps Jake with his girlfriend.

Title: A Live Woman of Proven Fertility
Description: When Judith announces she is going to remarry, Charlie and Alan must convince her fiancé to proceed with the nuptials after he displays signs of cold feet, so that Alan can discontinue alimony payments to Judith.

Title: Apologies for the Frivolity
Description: Charlie is the last one to realize that he is dating a younger version of his mother.

Title: Repeated Blows to His Unformed Head
Description: Charlie reluctantly agrees to help Berta as she confronts the man who impregnated her youngest daughter and Alan tells Charlie about a secret fetish.

Title: Release the Dogs
Description: After a bout with insomnia, Alan is escorted home from a midnight run on the beach by the local sheriff's department. Jake fights back when Charlie goes back on his word about not dating his friend's mother.

Title: Corey's Been Dead for an Hour
Description: Charlie finally gets fed up with Alan always weaseling his way out of picking up a bill, and it only gets worse when he discovers Alan's secret stash of money.

Title: Kissing Abraham Lincoln
Description: Charlie's new live-in girlfriend is skating on thin ice with Berta because she threatens Berta's "alpha dog" status and Kandi lets Alan have sex with her again so that he won't sell the condo.

Title: Walnuts and Demerol
Description: Charlie's quest to get laid on Christmas Eve threatens to fall apart when everybody shows up at his house and refuses to leave.

Title: Castrating Sheep in Montana
Description: Alan is seeing Berta's daughter behind everyone's back. But when Berta finds out, Alan is shocked and a little disturbed by her positive response.

Title: Don't Worry, Speed Racer
Description: Repressed memories come back to the surface for Charlie after Jake talks about hearing his mom having sex.

Title: That's Summer Sausage, Not Salami
Description: Charlie tries to set up Alan with the sexy and rich new next-door neighbor who is looking to settle down. But when Charlie discovers her secret history as a drunken slut, he decides to go after her himself.

Title: My Damn Stalker
Description: Alan takes a stab at online dating, and Rose tells Charlie that she's moving away.

Title: Young People Have Phlegm Too
Description: Charlie tries to convince himself and Alan that he's not too old to be part of the wild, young party crowd.

Title: I Merely Slept with a Commie
Description: After Charlie and Alan tell their mom that nobody loves her enough to attend her funeral, she replaces them with a new family, which makes both of them very jealous.

Title: It Never Rains in Hooterville
Description: Alan feels the pangs of fatherhood disappearing as Jake grows, and contemplates his future with Kandi, who is contemplating on a new career move.

Title: Smooth as a Ken Doll
Description: Alan thinks he's making his last alimony payment to Judith, but Judith's future sister-in-law could be putting the wedding in jeopardy. And things only get worse when she hooks up with Charlie.

Title: Aunt Myra Doesn't Pee a Lot
Description: Alan sees nothing but troubles in his future as Charlie's relationship with Judith's future sister-in-law blossoms.

Title: Tucked, Taped and Gorgeous
Description: Everyone suspects that Alan may be coming out of the closet when he becomes good friends with a gay man. But Charlie is actually the one who is suddenly feeling insecure about his sexuality.

Title: Mr. McGlue's Feedbag
Description: When Alan has to go renew his driver's license, he convinces Charlie to help Jake with book report. But when Charlie takes Jake to the track, instead, Jake's horse comes in.

Title: Anteaters. They're Just Crazy-lookin
Description: Charlie hires a handyman to fix his deck, then begins to feel threatened when all the women in his life flock to the new guy.

Title: Prostitutes and Gelato
Description: In an effort to bond with Alan and Charlie, Evelyn's new boyfriend invites them on a trip to Vegas with all the frills.

Title: Large Birds, Spiders and Mom
Description: Jake is ready to begin junior high school, until Alan scares him by telling him about all of the horrors that he experienced. Meanwhile, Charlie has a rash in a most inopportune area.

Title: Media Room Slash Dungeon
Description: Charlie and his mom temporarily become friends until Charlie takes an interest in one of her married clients and Alan goes to bed with a woman who has self-esteem issues.

Title: Dum Diddy Dum Diddy Doo
Description: Charlie humors Alan by going on a date with a woman his own age instead of a young bimbo. But when the woman rejects him after the first date, he becomes obsessed with seeing her again.

Title: City of Great Racks
Description: Charlie is getting serious with Linda. But lately he seems to be seeing his ex-stalker, Rose. Has she returned from England, or is it his imagination?

Title: Putting Swim Fins on a Cat
Description: Charlie hasn't had a paying gig for months, so Alan becomes part of a drug study to make extra money. Meanwhile, Charlie tries to bond with Linda's four-year-old son.

Title: Help Daddy Find His Toenail
Description: A medication mix-up causes Charlie to humiliate Linda at an important dinner, and Jake disobeys his dad's orders and sneaks out to attend a rock concert.

Title: Our Leather Gear Is in the Guest Room
Description: After Alan gets in a fight with Charlie over a decorative bowl, Alan and Jake move in with Alan's mom.

Title: Is There a Mrs. Waffles?
Description: Charlie discovers that being a children's singer means making lots of money and picking up single moms. But he also discovers that he's going to have to overcome his fear of performing in front of large audiences.

Title: Tight's Good
Description: Charlie ignores his future step-father's advice and gets involved with his daughter, and he learns the hard way that he should have heeded the warning.

Title: Kinda Like Necrophilia
Description: Alan finds out that Charlie stole his girlfriend in high school, so he sets out to even the score.

Title: Meander to Your Dander
Description: Alan's latest relationship has grown stale, so he turns to Charlie for advice about how to break up with her.

Title: A Little Clammy and None Too Fresh
Description: Charlie is suffering from a bad cold, and Rose suddenly and mysteriously resurfaces to "take care of him." So why isn't Charlie getting any better?

Title: The Soil is Moist
Description: Alan sleeps with a woman he and Judith were friends with when they were married, who then tells him that Judith says her new husband is a better lover than him.

Title: Winky-Dink Time
Description: Charlie sets up Alan with a prostitute and accompanies Jake on a double date.

Title: Rough Night in Hump Junction
Description: Charlie is acting even more promiscuous than normal, which is getting him in trouble with a lot of husbands and boyfriends. With the help of his psychiatrist, he discovers it's related to his ex-fiancée's upcoming wedding.

Title: Look at Me, Mommy, I'm Pretty
Description: Alan helps to plan his mother's wedding, and Charlie makes some moves on the woman who will soon be his stepsister.

Title: Fish in a Drawer
Description: Parody of "CSI" in which a body is found in Charlie's bed, and detectives try to figure out who is the killer.

Title: If My Hole Could Talk
Description: Charlie dates a self-help author who is much older than he is, has a 32-year-old son and treats Charlie more like a son than a boyfriend. Jake tries to write a book report over the weekend but keeps losing the book before he can read it.

Title: Waiting for the Right Snapper
Description: Alan has a crush on Charlie's new older girlfriend and Charlie discovers that he "dated" his girlfriend's son's fiancée. Meanwhile, Alan tries to get Jake to study for his algebra exam.

Title: Taterhead Is Our Love Child
Description: Charlie runs into an ex with a child who looks and acts a lot like him, and he starts to suspect that he is the boy's father.

Title: Pie Hole, Herb
Description: Charlie kicks Alan out the house again after Alan demands that Charlie pay him back the $38 he owes him. Alan and Jake are now forced to turn to Judith and Herb for a temporary home.

Title: Damn You, Eggs Benedict
Description: Alan tries to date two women at once and Charlie tries to learn how to cook. Jake tells Alan that he's studying with a friend, but he gets drunk instead.

Title: The Flavin' and the Mavin'
Description: Alan is angry when Charlie hooks up with his secretary because he knows that the situation will end badly for him after their inevitable breakup.

Title: A Jock Strap in Hell
Description: Charlie gets more than he bargained for when he tries to make amends to one of Jake's old teachers that he dated, who went off the deep end and became a stripper after he broke up with her.

Title: It's Always Nazi Week
Description: Alan is overjoyed when he learns that Judith and Herb's marriage is on the rocks, but he gets more than he bargained for when he tries to fake-comfort her. Meanwhile, Herb tries picking up women with Charlie's help.

Title: Best H.O. Money Can Buy
Description: Alan and Judith start seeing each other again after Judith's breakup with Herb, Herb continues to turn to Charlie for help picking up women, and Charlie messes with Jake by threatening to get him sent to military school.

Title: Pinocchio's Mouth
Description: Charlie's month-long relationship threatens to go down the tubes when she asks him to spend the night at her house instead. Alan grounds Jake for mooning some girls on a school bus.

Title: The Mooch at the Boo
Description: Alan realizes what a babe magnet Charlie's car can be while Charlie is left with the neighbor when his daughter disappears with Jake.

Title: He Smelled the Ham, He Got Excited
Description: When Evelyn offers to pay for Jake's college education and a car, Charlie suspects that she has an angle to play.

Title: The Devil's Lube
Description: Charlie contemplates making some changes in his life after an old buddy and partner in crime drops dead on the balcony of his beach house.

Title: Thank God for Scoliosis
Description: Alan considers hooking up with his receptionist--until he meets her mother, and Charlie and Jake fight for the affection of a beautiful woman

Title: I Think You Offended Don
Description: Judith is pregnant, Alan believes he is the father, and Judith tries to keep him away from Herb. Meanwhile, Charlie tries to figure out why Jake is so irritable.

Title: David Copperfield Slipped Me a Roofie
Description: After his family acts mean-spirited during Alan's "surprise" birthday party, Alan decides he's had enough and moves in with his girlfriend and her mom.

Title: I'd Like to Start with the Cat
Description: Charlie's big mouth and lack of attention to details gets him in couples counseling with his girlfriend.

Title: She'll Still Be Dead at Halftime
Description: Charlie needs Alan and Jake's help getting rid of the drunk, half-naked bimbo passed out in his bed when his girlfriend tells him she's coming home early from a funeral.

Title: The 'Ocu' or the 'Pado'?
Description: Charlie is so desperate to get Chelsea to return his accidental "I love you" and not lose control in the relationship that he is willing to propose to her just to make her say it.

Title: My Son's Enormous Head
Description: Charlie has trouble trying to take care of Chelsea when she gets sick.

Title: The Two Finger Rule
Description: Charlie, Alan and Herb commiserate with each other when their stupid decisions put them on the outs with their significant others.

Title: Hello, I am Alan Cousteau
Description: Charlie is disturbed when his mother meets Chelsea and starts spending time with her, but he has a plan for revenge.

Title: Above Exalted Cyclops
Description: Chelsea sets up Alan with her new "friend" Rose--the same Rose who stalked Charlie for years. But to Charlie's surprise, the two of them hit it off.

Title: Sir Lancelot's Litter Box
Description: Charlie winds up in more hot water with Chelsea because he doesn't want her moving in with him.

Title: Good Morning, Mrs. Butterworth
Description: Charlie is angry when Alan and Chelsea become good friends, until he figures out how to use the situation to his advantage.

Title: Baseball Was Better with Steroids
Description: Chelsea is jealous when Charlie's ex fiancée, Mia, calls him--perhaps rightfully so. Meanwhile, Judith goes into labor, Herb is incapacitated, and Alan runs into his ex-girlfriend and receptionist at the hospital.

Title: 818-jklpuzo
Description: Chelsea encourages Charlie to help his ex-fiancée Mia launch her music career, but does he still have feelings for her? And what if she's a terrible singer? Meanwhile, Alan wants Charlie to let Melissa move in with him.

Title: Whipped Unto the Third Generation
Description: When Charlie's fiancée, Chelsea, convinces him to let Melissa, Alan's girlfriend, move in, the girls take over the house.

Title: Mmm, Fish. Yum.
Description: Alan is forced to take care of Judith's baby when Judith's mom falls off the wagon, and Jake tries to blackmail Charlie when he runs over Chelsea's cat.

Title: Laxative Tester, Horse Inseminator
Description: Alan takes a job with his mom so that he can move out and have alone time with Melissa, and Chelsea is upset about the way that Jake is treating her.

Title: For the Sake of the Child
Description: Jake refuses to stay with Charlie and Alan after they embarrass him in public, so Alan tries to convince Charlie to work together to settle their differences and stop fighting with each other.

Title: Give Me Your Thumb
Description: Alan suggests that Chelsea get breast reduction surgery and Charlie kicks him out.

Title: Untainted by Filth
Description: After Charlie and Chelsea set their wedding date, Charlie and Alan go out and get drunk and wake up in bed together with a strange woman.

Title: Gorp. Fnark. Schmegle.
Description: Charlie invites Chelsea's sexy friend to stay at his place while she gets over a breakup, secretly hoping that he will get a chance to have kinky three-way sex.

Title: Captain Terry's Spray-On Hair
Description: Charlie is crushed when he discovers he hasn't been satisfying Chelsea and Alan attempts to cure his thinning hair on the cheap.

Title: That's Why They Call It 'Ball Room'
Description: Charlie discovers that Chelsea hasn't been completely honest about her finances.

Title: Warning, It's Dirty
Description: Against Alan's wishes, Charlie encourages Jake to hook up with a pretty girl he met on the beach since Jake's girlfriend is out of town for Christmas.

Title: Fart Jokes, Pie and Celeste
Description: Jake writes love songs to woo his ex-girlfriend, and Herb and Alan hide their secret friendship from Judith's watchful eye.

Title: Yay, No Polyps
Description: Charlie endures a colonoscopy to get out of a trip to see Chelsea's bigoted parents, only to return home and find them in his living room.

Title: Crude and Uncalled For
Description: Alan ends up in jail after a bar fight, and Charlie worries that Chelsea might be interested in the lawyer who takes the case.

Title: Aye, Aye, Captain Douche
Description: When Charlie's jealousy threatens his relationship with Chelsea, he turns to Alan for help in becoming a better person. But will he be able to pull it off?

Title: Tinkle Like a Princess
Description: Charlie reacts to his breakup with Chelsea by taking the first woman that he sees and marrying her in Las Vegas.

Title: I Found Your Moustache
Description: Charlie and Chelsea get back together for one night, which leaves Charlie mistakenly believing that they are back for good.

Title: Ixnay on the Oggie Day
Description: Charlie hooks up with Chelsea's best friend, which could cause problems when Chelsea wants to get back together. Meanwhile, Alan is paid handsomely by a chiropractic patient who wants a different kind of adjustment.

Title: Keith Moon Is Vomiting in His Grave
Description: Alan dates the mom of one of Jake's friends instead of telling her that her son and Jake went out drinking, but Charlie surprisingly does not approve of his actions.

Title: I Called Him Magoo
Description: Alan's plan for a romantic overnight getaway with his girlfriend hits an unexpected snag, while Charlie has an unusual request for his overnight companion.

Title: Gumby with a Pokey
Description: While Alan and Jake go to Sacramento to pick up a grandfather clock, Charlie gets a prescription for medical marijuana to help him sleep and forget about Chelsea.

Title: This Is Not Gonna End Well
Description: Jake becomes Charlie's driver after Charlie has his license suspended, and to Charlie's chagrin, Alan makes plans to attend Chelsea's birthday party.

Title: Three Girls and a Guy Named Bud
Description: Alan unsuccessfully tries to keep Jake from finding out that he's sleeping with his friend Eldridge's mom; Charlie contemplates giving up drinking after an unusually wild night he can't remember.

Title: A Bottle of Wine and a Jackhammer
Description: When Lindsey asks Alan to move in with her, Charlie will do anything to get Alan to say "yes."

Title: A Pudding-Filled Cactus
Description: Alan moves in with Lyndsey but continues to have a rendezvous with Melissa at Charlie's house.

Title: Hookers, Hookers, Hookers
Description: Lyndsey and Eldridge move into Charlie's house after Alan burns down their home.

Title: The Immortal Mr. Billy Joel
Description: Alan goes out on the town pretending to be Charlie; Charlie sneaks off for cosmetic surgery.

Title: Twanging Your Magic Clanger
Description: Charlie has second thoughts about the woman he's dating when he discovers she's 47, but his attitude suddenly changes when he discovers she has a sexy, bisexual, 20-year-old daughter.

Title: The Crazy Bitch Gazette
Description: Charlie's past comes back to bite him when his girlfriend decides that his stalker Rose is too much to handle.

Title: Springtime on a Stick
Description: Jake gets Alan to invite Evelyn to Charlie's house for her birthday dinner to get revenge for Charlie ruining his chances with a classmate; and Alan and Charlie get Charlie's pharmacist to come along as Evelyn's date.

Title: A Good Time in Central Africa
Description: While Berta is out for the weekend, Charlie finds the perfect replacement housekeeper; when Lyndsey starts dating Alan again, her ex starts stalking him.

Title: Ow, Ow, Don't Stop
Description: Charlie goes on a spending spree for his old fling Courtney, who shows up after three years in prison for conning him out of money.

Title: Dead from the Waist Down
Description: Alan is ashamed that he can't afford to buy Lyndsey a birthday present, so he gets creative.

Title: Chocolate Diddlers or My Puppy's Dead
Description: When Charlie and Courtney break up, Charlie falls into a depression and visits his psychiatrist.

Title: Skunk, Dog Crap and Ketchup
Description: When Charlie and Lyndsey start becoming friendly, Alan's paranoia gets the best of him.

Title: Lookin' for Japanese Subs
Description: Charlie continues to obsess over Rose--whom he thinks is married--after running into her at the store, and Jake and Eldrige begin recording their own "Jackass" rip-off.

Title: Three Hookers and a Philly Cheesesteak
Description: Alan's efforts to ask family for money to help promote his struggling chiropractic business turns into a Ponzi scheme, and Charlie continues to see Rose, still completely unaware that her "husband" is actually a mannequin.

Title: That Darn Priest
Description: Rose becomes wise to Alan's Ponzi scheme and threatens to tell his family--until Alan discovers the truth about Rose's "husband."

Title: Nice to Meet You, Walden Schmidt
Description: After the death of Charlie Harper, Alan faces the reality of moving out of his brother's beach house - until he meets a depressed Internet billionaire whose wife just left him.

Title: People Who Love Peepholes
Description: Walden buys Charlie's house and hires Berta as his live-in housekeeper, forcing Alan to move back in with his mom. However, Alan sees an opportunity to come back when Walden asks for advice about getting his wife back.

Title: Big Girls Don't Throw Food
Description: While preparing for a romantic dinner with his wife, Walden accidentally talks Jake into dropping out of school.

Title: Nine Magic Fingers
Description: Alan begins working on getting Lyndsey back, but his days at Walden's place may be numbered after Walden hooks up with Charlie's gold-digger ex girlfriend, Courtney.

Title: A Giant Cat Holding a Churro
Description: Lyndsey dumps Alan after he agrees to be completely honest about his past, and a stoned Walden tries to cheer him up by throwing him a party.

Title: The Squat and the Hover
Description: Alan convinces Walden to see Charlie's old shrink after he gets his divorce papers from Bridget, but his spirits are soon lifted after he meets a lesbian who looks like her.

Title: Those Fancy Japanese Toilets
Description: Walden hires Evelyn as his interior decorator, but Alan is convinced that she just wants to take advantage of him sexually. Meanwhile, Alan inherits Charlie's journal, and Jake has a crush on his tutor, but she has a crush on Walden.

Title: Thank You for the Intercourse
Description: Still emotional after Charlie's death and jealous over Walden's ability to pick up hot single women, Alan takes a break from reality and channels his inner Charlie.

Title: Frodo's Headshots
Description: Upon his return from the "stress clinic," Alan finds out that Jake got his girlfriend pregnant, Walden and Lyndsey are sleeping together, and he has to move out immediately.

Title: A Fishbowl Full of Glass Eyes
Description: After Jake talks Walden into asking out a woman he meets at a supermarket, Alan considers hocking Walden's incredibly expensive wedding ring to get out of debt.

Title: What a Lovely Landing Strip
Description: Just as Walden appears ready to pursue a new relationship with Zoe, Bridget returns and says that she wants him back.

Title: One False Move, Zimbabwe!
Description: Walden's mother arrives for Christmas and Alan is smitten with her, even as she reveals a secret about a "pet" from Walden's past that sends him into a downward spiral.

Title: Slowly and in a Circular Fashion
Description: When Bridget and Walden's mother try to take control of Walden's company, Walden puts Alan on the board. But can he be trusted once Walden's mother gets to him?

Title: A Possum on Chemo
Description: While Zoe pressures Walden into shaving and cutting his hair, Alan discovers that Lyndsey is dating a younger man.

Title: The Duchess of Dull-in-Sack
Description: Walden looks for ways to spice up his lackluster love life with Zoey, including a batch of Berta's "special" brownies.

Title: Sips, Sonnets and Sodomy
Description: Alan and Walden are stuck at home with their feuding girlfriends on Valentine's Day because of a torrential storm.

Title: Not in My Mouth!
Description: When Zoey doesn't return his "I love you," Walden retaliates by immediately picking up on another woman.

Title: The War Against Gingivitis
Description: Walden's estranged ex-business partner comes to him with a billion-dollar business idea, and another secret or two.

Title: Palmdale, Ech
Description: Alan and Lyndsey introduce their mothers to each other, while Walden spends the night hanging out with Jake and Eldrige since Zoey is still out of town.

Title: Grandma's Pie
Description: Zoe is upset when she finds out that Bridget is a business partner in Walden's latest venture, while Alan and Lyndsey have an awkward dinner with their moms, who are now lovers and are planning to move in together.

Title: Mr. Hose Says 'Yes'
Description: Walden's commitment is tested when Zoey and her daughter come to live with him. Meanwhile, Alan gets more than he bargained for when he moves in with Lyndsey.

Title: Why We Gave Up Women
Description: Charlie's spirit returns from Hell in the form of a middle aged woman to tell Alan to make some changes to his life after his heart attack.

Title: The Straw in My Donut Hole
Description: Alan decides to take advantage of the guilt felt by his family and Walden after his heart attack, but Zoe knows that he's just milking it and sets out to prove it.

Title: Oh Look! Al-Qaeda!
Description: Jake and Eldridge make an important decision about their future after they graduate from high school and get fired from their jobs at Walden's new company.

Title: I Changed My Mind About the Milk
Description: Walden weighs his options after his elaborate marriage proposal featuring fireworks and Michael Bolton fails.

Title: A Big Bag of Dog
Description: While Alan becomes obsessed with off-brand teeth whitening, Walden begins to crack up over his breakup with Zoe.

Title: Four Balls, Two Bats and One Mitt
Description: Alan agrees to Lyndsey's idea of having a threesome with Walden, but Walden can't follow through because he's still in love with Zoey.

Title: You Do Know What the Lollipop Is For
Description: Walden is conflicted when a friend's hot daughter comes to visit, but the problem solves itself when Jake arrives for a surprise visit.

Title: That's Not What They Call It in Amsterdam
Description: After a series of bad double date setups with Alan and Lyndsey, Walden meets a new woman--Charlie's ex, Rose.

Title: Ferrets, Attack!
Description: Just as Walden considers making a big move in his relationship with Rose, Zoey re-enters the picture and asks him to take her back.

Title: Avoid the Chinese Mustard
Description: Jake goes AWOL from the Army to spend another weekend with Missi, and Walden hires an actress to play the role of his girlfriend.

Title: Something My Gynecologist Said
Description: Alan loses Lyndsey over his refusal to make a long-term commitment, while Walden becomes a "boy toy" for a rich older woman who has no idea that he's a billionaire.

Title: I Scream When I Pee
Description: Alan's second ex-wife, Kandi, could spoil Alan's new long-term relationship with Lyndsey. Meanwhile, Walden tries to celebrate Berta's birthday.

Title: One Nut Johnson
Description: Walden creates an "Everyman" persona and finds a woman who isn't interested in him because of his money.

Title: Give Santa a Tail-Hole
Description: While Walden takes a job as a Christmas tree salesman as part of his ruse, he gets a billion dollar business proposal from Mark Zuckerberg. Meanwhile, Alan finds himself completely alone at the beach house for the holidays.

Title: Welcome to Alancrest
Description: While Walden's health and other bedroom issues begin to suffer as a result of living a lie, he gives Alan 100,000 dollars to "invest" in Kate's fashion line.

Title: Grab a Feather and Get in Line
Description: Walden and Alan fly to New York City so that Walden can finally reveal his true identity to Kate.

Title: Run, Steven Staven! Run!
Description: Alan, Walden, Billy, and Herb spend the night out together commiserating over their exes after Lyndsey dumps Alan one more time.

Title: Paint It, Pierce It or Plug It
Description: Alan is alarmed when he discovers that Jake's new girlfriend is almost twice his age, has three children, and owns a tattoo parlor.

Title: Advantage: Fat, Flying Baby
Description: Walden is delighted when Kate flies to LA and asks an appointment on Valentine's Day. Alas, she only wants friendship, still prefers 'Sam' and now has just a busy calendar as Walden, so no next date can be booked. For once, Alan decides to 'spoil' Lyndsey on Valentine's Day by booking a hotel suite he can't really afford. But pubic grooming on himself goes so bad she has to drive him to hospital instead. Rose is unsuspecting Kate's new business partner, who lures her to China.

Title: Throgwarten Middle School Mysteries
Description: Walden goes to a mixer to find a woman but runs into his ex-wife Bridget instead.

Title: The 9:04 from Pemberton
Description: After Alan and Walden fight over a toaster, Alan moves out and goes back to his old house to live with Herb.

Title: Big Episode: Someone Stole a Spoon
Description: Alan and Walden take Herb out to take his mind off of his troubles, but his partying quickly spirals out of control.

Title: Bazinga! That's From a TV Show
Description: Tammy comes after Jake after he cheats on her with her 18 year old daughter.

Title: Another Night with Neil Diamond
Description: Alan is crushed when Lyndsey dumps him and immediately starts dating a new man, and Walden is crushed because he is now completely stuck with Alan--again.

Title: My Bodacious Vidalia
Description: Walden treats Alan to an image makeover, and he attracts a married woman with a much older husband who cannot satisfy her in bed.

Title: Cows, Prepare to Be Tipped
Description: Walden dates a sexy young woman, but is actually more interested in her grandmother. Meanwhile, Alan and Jake take a final road trip together before Jake leaves for Japan.

Title: Nangnangnangnang
Description: Walden is forced to deal with two freeloading Harpers when Charlie's daughter that nobody knew he had arrives at the beach house.

Title: I Think I Banged Lucille Ball
Description: Charlie's daughter Jenny moves in with Evelyn and her 91 1/2 year old boyfriend, and Lyndsey cheats on her new boyfriend with Alan.

Title: This Unblessed Biscuit
Description: Berta is injured on the job, and after getting in an argument with Walden over retirement, she decides to quit.

Title: Clank, Clank, Drunken Skank
Description: Walden makes a big mistake while partying with Jenny and her friends, and Alan has to make a big sacrifice to keep up appearances with Lyndsey.

Title: Alan Harper, Pleasing Women Since 2003
Description: Alan's jealousy over being the "other man" causes him to spy on Lyndsey's boyfriend, and Walden tries to get Jenny started with acting lessons.

Title: Justice in Star-Spangled Hot Pants
Description: Alan begs Walden to set him up with an old family friend, "Wonder Woman" TV star Lynda Carter.

Title: Some Kind of Lesbian Zombie
Description: Alan and Walden hook up with a pair of theme park princesses until Lyndsey's jealousy of Alan's new flame ruins everything.

Title: Mr. Walden, He Die. I Clean Room.
Description: A private investigator tells Lyndsey's boyfriend that she is cheating on him with Walden, and Rose tries to help keep Walden out of danger.

Title: Numero Uno Accidente Lawyer
Description: Walden has a date with an injury-prone model, and Alan sleeps with a woman who then reveals that she used to be a man.

Title: On Vodka, on Soda, on Blender, on Mixer!
Description: Walden helps Jenny get a second date with a woman who is blowing her off, and Alan is propositioned by his new girlfriend's ex.

Title: Tazed in the Lady Nuts
Description: Walden is hired by a former employee he fired to write code for a new project, and Alan suffers an unfortunate tick bite while hiking with Jenny and her girlfriend.

Title: Baseball. Boobs. Boobs. Baseball.
Description: Alan lets Lyndsey's boyfriend Larry set him up on a date, while Walden offers to help Nicole with her software project, so that she will have the time to date him.

Title: Bite Me, Supreme Court
Description: Marty proposes to Evelyn, and she accepts. But after Alan and Walden throw Marty a bachelor party, he abruptly calls off the wedding.

Title: Three Fingers of Crème de Menthe
Description: After Alan learns that Lyndsey broke up with Larry and didn't tell him, he makes a big decision. Meanwhile, Walden sets out to prove that he's a man's man.

Title: Cab Fare and a Bottle of Penicillin
Description: Alan turns to Judith for comfort after Lyndsey accepts Larry's marriage proposal, and Jenny is worried that Brooke is blowing her off.

Title: How to Get Rid of Alan Harper
Description: Alan takes an interest in Larry's sister after "Jeff Strongman" agrees to be his best man, and Walden is concerned about his relationship with Nicole.

Title: Welcome Home, Jake
Description: Lyndsey discovers that Alan is sleeping with Larry's sister, Gretchen. Meanwhile, Walden finds it difficult with telling Barry to find his own place.

Title: West Side Story
Description: Walden's reunion with his ex-girlfriend Kate does not go as planned, and Alan takes Gretchen over to "his apartment."

Title: Lan mao shi zai wuding shang
Description: Just as Walden is considering proposing to Kate, he falls for a random stranger who arrives at his beach house. Meanwhile, Gretchen discovers that Alan's "Jeff Strongman" persona is a lie.

Title: Lotta Delis in Little Armenia
Description: Walden's therapist tells him to have plenty of random casual sex to help get over falling in love too quickly, and Alan's new business venture provides him with the perfect opportunity.

Title: Dial 1-900-Mix-A-Lot
Description: Walden goes to Colorado with Jenny and Barry after he finds his first car. Meanwhile, Alan loses Gretchen after he considers telling Larry the truth about "Jeff Strongman."

Title: Oh WALD-E, Good Times Ahead
Description: When Alan and Gretchen get engaged and Larry calls off the wedding, Lyndsey goes off the deep end. Meanwhile, Walden creates a smart-aleck robot.

Title: The Ol' Mexican Spinach
Description: When Walden has a health scare on Halloween, he tries to re-prioritize his life with the help of Alan.

Title: A Chic Bar in Ibiza
Description: Alan has second thoughts about getting married when Walden has him sign a prenup.

Title: Glamping in a Yurt
Description: Alan and Walden must be perceived as a loving couple during a meeting with an adoption social worker. However, Lyndsey returns from rehab and makes their plans more difficult.

Title: Thirty-Eight, Sixty-Two, Thirty-Eight
Description: After the social worker signs off on them, a prospective birth mother visits Walden and Alan.

Title: Oontz. Oontz. Oontz.
Description: Walden looks after a foster child named Louis,but they don't bond the way he hoped they would.

Title: Alan Shot a Little Girl
Description: Much to Walden's frustration, Louis successfully manipulates Alan, who cannot resist the opportunity to finally get to become the cool parent.

Title: Sex with an Animated Ed Asner
Description: Walden and Alan befriend a group of sexy single moms while taking Louis out to play, which makes it even more difficult to keep up their charade.

Title: Family, Bublé, Deep-Fried Turkey
Description: Walden hopes to create the perfect Christmas experience for Louis, who has lost his faith in Christmas. But Santa, Alan's mom Evelyn, and Alan's cheapness threaten to ruin everything.

Title: Bouncy, Bouncy, Bouncy, Lyndsey
Description: Walden and Laurel set up a playdate for their kids so they can pick up where they left off the last time they got together. Meanwhile, Herb asks Alan if he can ask Lyndsey out.

Title: Here I Come, Pants!
Description: When Ms. McMartin discovers that Walden and Alan are pretending to be gay, she threatens to take Louis away. However, Alan has a plan to help her change her mind.

Title: For Whom the Booty Calls
Description: When Walden joins a support group for adoptive fathers, he discovers that it is a nice getaway from Alan.

Title: A Beer-Battered Rip-Off
Description: Walden worries that Louis' adoption will be impacted when Alan breaks up with their social worker.

Title: Boompa Loved His Hookers
Description: Walden discovers that Ms. McMartin is crazy and needy after they hook up, but he doesn't want to break up with her and mess up the adoption. Meanwhile, Lyndsey asks Alan to move in with her.

Title: Don't Give a Monkey a Gun
Description: When their divorce becomes official, Walden offers Alan a gift. Alan's impractical choice strains his relationship with Lindsay.

Title: Of Course He's Dead: Part 1 & 2
Description: Alan begins to suspect that Charlie is still alive, which is confirmed when he receives a threatening package and Rose tells the truth.
